Legal_Issue: Did the citizenship judge err in concluding that the applicant did not meet the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act?
Application_Facts: Applicant provided a passport confirming 1,097 days of physical presence in Canada during the four years preceding the application.
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination of the application by a different citizenship judge.
Court_Ruling: The citizenship judge erred by applying two tests (Pourghasemi and Koo) and rejecting persuasive evidence without justification.
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge applied an incorrect legal test and failed to properly assess evidence.
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous application of residency tests and unjustified rejection of evidence.
Legal_Standard: Physical presence in Canada for at least 1,095 days in the four years before application.
Assessment_Factor: Quantity of days present, not quality of residence.
Procedural_Issue: Appeal to the Federal Court challenging the citizenship judge's decision.
Credibility_Assessment: No issue with credibility; passport evidence was persuasive.
Evidence_Used: Passport showing 1,097 days of physical presence.
Evidence_Assessed: Passport records confirming days in Canada.
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and referral back for redetermination.
Governing_Rule: Only one test should be applied to determine residency: physical presence for 1,095 days.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; the applicant met the burden with credible evidence.
Outcome: Appeal allowed; case referred back to a different citizenship judge.
Harm_Assessment: Unjust denial of citizenship due to legal error.
Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was rejected due to alleged failure to meet residency requirements.
Evidence_Handling: Judge improperly questioned quality of residence and dismissed valid evidence without justification.
Evidence_Issues: Improper rejection of passport evidence without sufficient reason.
Evidence_Assessment: Passport evidence was clear and sufficient to prove residency.
Decision_Rationale: The judge incorrectly applied two tests instead of focusing solely on the required number of days.
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to justify rejection of documentary evidence.
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective measure of physical presence for 1,095 days.
